titles.title: SHIELDS Act
To amend title 10, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Defense to establish a prescription drug monitoring program.
Sharing Health Information to Ensure Lifesaving Drug Safety Act
SHIELDS Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

term.name: Drug safety, medical device, and laboratory regulation

bill.summary:
Sharing Health Information to Ensure Lifesaving Drug Safety Act or the SHIELDS Act
This bill directs the Department of Defense to establish and operate the Military Health System Prescription Drug Monitoring Program, which shall cover controlled substances provided as prescription drugs under the pharmacy benefits program. The monitoring program shall be comparable to state-operated prescription drug monitoring programs, including those approved by the Department of Health and Human Services.
